subject: Self Care
title: The Relapse Trap
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Relapse Trap usable.

hook.text: Thirty days clean. One slip. 'I failed.' You abandon everything and return to the old habit completely.

buildup.text: The abstinence violation effect means one slip feels like total failure, triggering a full relapse.

discovery.text: One mistake doesn't erase progress. Thirty good days and one bad day is still a 97% success rate.

twist.text: The slip isn't the problem. The story you tell yourself about the slip is what causes the full collapse.

climax.text: If you stumble, return to the habit immediately. Never miss twice. That's the only rule that matters.

punchline.text: One slip is not failure. Two in a row is danger.

quiz.question: What is the abstinence violation effect?
options: One slip feeling like total failure and triggering full relapse
Relapses are impossible to recover from
